programme.title: EGY-MAR - Men's Bronze Medal Match | Football | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's Bronze Medal match with Egypt and Morocco, at La Beaujoire Stadium, Nantes, on 08/08/24. Final score MAR 6:0 EGY.

programme.title: FRA-ESP - Men's Gold Medal Match | Football | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's Gold Medal Match France v Spain, at Parc des Princes, Paris, on 09/08/24. Final score ESP 5:3 FRA.

programme.title: The Golden Generation | Five Rings Films
programme.desc: How a once-in-a-generation Argentina men's basketball team, led by Manu Ginobili, brought down the USA “Dream Team” and won the gold at the Athens 2004 Olympic Games.

programme.title: Memory Lane | 72 - A Gathering of Champions
programme.desc: Fifty years after their Olympic victories in Munich, famed gymnast Olga Korbut, Germany’s long jump star Heide Rosendahl, Kenya’s long-distance running hero Kip Keino and Great Britain’s celebrated pentathlete Mary Peters make an emotional return to the scene of their gold medal wins.

programme.title: Women’s Football Final, Sydney 2000
programme.desc: In its second Olympic appearance, Norway's stars are pitted against the USA, consistently the dominant nation in women’s football.

programme.title: USA-SRB - Men's Semi-Final | Basketball | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's Semi-Final match between USA and Serbia took place at the Bercy Arena on 08/08/24. Final score USA 95:91 SRB.

programme.title: FRA-BEL - Women's Semi-Final | Basketball | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This Women's Semi-Final took place at the Bercy Arena, France, on 09/08/24. France won this Game with a final score: FRA 81:75 BEL.

programme.title: El Palomar Basketball Team
programme.desc: Team USA Olympic hero Kara Wolters travels to Mexico to try to turn around the fortunes of a struggling basketball team.

programme.title: USA-FRA - Men's Gold Medal Game | Basketball | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This Gold Medal Game took place at Bercy Arena, France, on 10/08/2024. The United States of America won the Gold with a final score: USA 98:87 FRA.

programme.title: The Olympics On The Record | Episode 4
programme.desc: Devers and Ottey's photo finish, a pole vault gamble, the queens of softball are overthrown, Johnson's historic 200m, and The Dream Team.

programme.title: USA-FRA - Women's Gold Medal Game | Basketball | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This Gold Medal Game took place at Bercy Arena, France, on 11/08/2024. The United States of America won the Gold with a final score: USA 67:66 FRA.

programme.title: Men’s Basketball Final, London 2012
programme.desc: In the closest finish in 40 years, the USA played Spain for the men's basketball gold medal, in a thrilling rematch.

programme.title: FRA-EGY - Men's Semi-Final | Football | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This Men's Semi-Final match with France v Egypt, at Lyon Stadium, Lyon, on 05/08/24. Final score FRA 3:1 EGY.

programme.title: Kiwi defender who survived it all, ready for World Cup | World at their Feet
programme.desc: Rebekah Stott, who plays for Brighton & Hove Albion in the English FA Women's Super League, is also a veteran of two Olympics and cancer survivor. She was sidelined by her illness and missed Tokyo 2020 but she is now back stronger than ever on New Zealand’s national team and looking forward to an emotional home World Cup as well as becoming a three-time Olympian next summer in Paris.

programme.title: Atletico Madrid's darling is key to Colombia success | World at their Feet
programme.desc: Her parents sacrificed everything to give her a chance to achieve her dream of becoming a professional player. From a farming village in the middle of Colombia to being the best number 10 of her country, Leicy Santos’ story is an amazing journey. She left alone to Bogota at 12 and at 15 years old, she was called into the national team. She participated in Rio 2016 Olympics. After winning the first ever professional women’s championship in 2017 with Santa Fe, in 2019, she was the first ever Colombian Player to be signed for a European team, first Colombian player to score in the Champions League and MVP in 2019/20 for Atletico Madrid. She now targets top 3 at FIFA Women’s World Cup 2023.

programme.title: Brighton keeper from Australia in fourth World Cup | World at their Feet
programme.desc: Lydia Williams grew up in an Aboriginal community in the middle of Western Australia. At 11, she moved to Canberra. Her mum who was from the US signed her up for football. The local club that she joined only had one position left in division one: goalkeeper. She lost her father at 15 and put all her efforts into football. She was 16 when she made her debut for Australia and 19 at her first World Cup. Rio 2016 Olympics was a special moment for her since Cathy Freeman had always inspired her. Having competed in three world cups and two Olympic Games, she has now reached 100 caps, no doubt that this home competition will be very special for her.

programme.title: US Captain determined to give it all to defend title | World at their Feet
programme.desc: Lindsey Horan is one of the first US players to have joined a European club as she decided to skip college and become professional at 18 when joining PSG. The normal path for any US footballer was College and then playing for one of the US teams. She overcame tough times and by the end of her time in PSG she had scored 46 goals in 58 appearances. She left Europe for Portland to achieve her dream of playing at the Olympics in Rio 2016. Winning the 2019 World Cup with the team was definitely a key moment but she sees her Bronze medal in Tokyo 2020 as the highlight of her international career so far.

programme.title: ESP-BRA - Women's Semi-Final | Football | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This Womens's Semi-Final match with Spain v Brasil, at Marseille Stadium, Marseille, on 06/08/24. Final score BRA 4:2 ESP.

programme.title: Men’s Football Final, Atlanta 1996
programme.desc: Mighty football nation Argentina in an Olympic final against Nigeria hoping to become the first major football champion from Africa.

programme.title: ESP-GER - Women's Bronze Medal Match | Football | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Bronze Medal Match Spain v Germany, at Lyon Stadium, Lyon, on 09/08/24. Final score GER 1:0 ESP.

programme.title: Can an Olympic legend turn around Hout Bay's football team?
programme.desc: Team South Africa Olympic footballing legend Matthew Booth tries to turn around the fortunes of a struggling local football team.

programme.title: BRA-USA - Women's Gold Medal Match | Football | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This Woman's Gold Medal Match took place at Parc des Princes, Paris, on 10/08/2024. The United States of America won the Gold with a victory over Brazil. Final score USA 1:0 BRA.

programme.title: Women's Team QFs/SFs/Finals | Archery | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Quarter-Finals, Semi-Finals and Finals for Women's Team Archery took place on 28/07/2024 at Invalides, Paris. The Republic of Korea won Gold, France won Silver, and Turkey won Bronze.

programme.title: South Korea's Olympic Records in Women's Archery
programme.desc: Unique training methods and nerves of steel make South Korea's archers the most accurate and dominant in the world.

programme.title: Sports Swap: Archery vs Curling Swap with Lisa Unruh & Niklas Edin
programme.desc: Can an Olympic silver medallist archer hit the target on an ice sheet? What happens when a curling champion tries to shoot an arrow?

programme.title: Behind the Screen | Paris 2024
programme.desc: A look behind the scenes at how OBS broadcasts the biggest sporting event in the world.

programme.title: Men's Floor, Women's Vault, Men's Pommel Horse | Artistic Gymnastics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This Artistic Gymnastics session took place at the Bercy Arena, France, on 03/08/2024. At the Men's Floor Exercise Final Carlos Edriel Yulo (PHI) won the Gold medal, Artem Dolgopyat (ISR) claimed the Silver, and Jake Jarman (GBR) took the Bronze. At the Women's Vault Final, Simone Biles (USA) won the Gold medal, Rebeca Andrade (BRA) took the Silver, and Jade Carey (USA) claimed the Bronze. And at the Men's Pommel Horse Final, Rhys Mc Clenaghan (IRL) claimed the Gold medal, while Nariman Kurbanov (KAZ) won the Silver and Stephen Nedoroscik (USA) took the Bronze.

programme.title: Men's Shot Put Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's Shot Put Final took place on 03/08/2024 at the Stade de France. Ryan Crouser (USA) won the Gold, Joe Kovacs (USA) won the Silver and Rajindra Campbell (JAM) the Bronze.

programme.title: Leonardo Fabbri’s success is rooted in family support | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: From his early athletic beginnings to his emotional 22.34m throw, Leonardo's journey is marked by family support and a dream of Olympic success. Despite setbacks, his determination remains unshaken as he aims for glory at Paris 2024. The Tuscan shot putter won gold at the European Championships, setting a championship record and placing him as a serious contender for the coming games.

programme.title: Women's Triple Jump Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Triple Jump Final took place on 03/08/2024 at the Stade de France. Thea LaFond (DMA) took the Gold with a 15.02m jump. Shanieka Ricketts (JAM) took the Silver and Jasmine Moore (USA) took the Bronze.

programme.title: Men's Javelin Throw Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's Javelin Throw Final took place at the Stade de France, France, on 08/08/2024. Arshad Nadeem (PAK) won the Golden Medal, Neeraj CHOPRA (IND) Silver Medal and Anderson PETERS (GRN) Bronze Medal.

programme.title: Women's Long Jump Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Long Jump Final took place at the Stade de France, France, on 08/08/2024. Tara DAVIS-WOODHALL (USA) won the Gold medal, Malaika MIHAMBO (GER) won the Silver medal and Jasmine MOORE (USA) won the Bronze medal.

programme.title: The Make Over | Athing Mu and Tinashe | From The Top
programme.desc: Music artist Tinashe invites Athing Mu into her world as she prepares for a concert. The track star gets made up by the Tinashe’s glam squad and shows off some dance moves on stage.

programme.title: Teams Acrobatic Routine | Artistic Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Teams Acrobatic Routine took place at Aquatics Centre, Paris, on 07/08/24. Team People's Republic of China won Gold, United States of America won Silver and Spain completed the podium.

programme.title: Duets Free Routine Final | Artistic Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Duets Free Routine Final took place at the Aquatics Centre, on 10/08/24. Liuyi Wang/Quianyi Wang (CHN) won Gold, Kate Shortman/Isabelle Thorpe (GBR) won Silver and Bregje de Brouwer/Noortje de Brouwer (NED) completed the podium.
